title: 107_hr3285
content: The "Federal-Local Information Sharing Partnership Act of 2001" allows sharing of grand jury information with state or local law enforcement personnel, subject to guidelines issued by the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. SEC. 3 amends Section 2517(6) of title 18, United States Code to allow sharing of interception information with state or local law enforcement personnel, subject to guidelines issued by the Attorney General. SEC. 4 amends the USA PATRIOT ACT to allow sharing of foreign intelligence information with state or local law enforcement personnel, who must use the information according to guidelines issued by the Attorney General. SEC. 5 amends the Fair Credit Reporting Act to allow disclosure of consumer reports to law enforcement personnel for counterterrorism purposes, with guidelines issued by the Attorney General for confidentiality protection. Section 222(f) of the Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to allow the Secretary of State to provide records related to visas or permits to law enforcement personnel of a State if deemed necessary. The subdivision of a State receiving information must use it in accordance with guidelines issued by the Attorney General to protect confidentiality. SEC. 7 amends the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act to include state law enforcement personnel in information acquired from electronic surveillance. SEC. 8 also includes state law enforcement personnel in information acquired from physical searches. SEC. 9 addresses the disclosure of educational records. SEC. 9 amends the General Education Provisions Act to allow disclosure of educational records to state law enforcement personnel for official duties. It also specifies that the information received should be used in accordance with guidelines. SEC. 10 amends the National Education Statistics Act to allow disclosure of reports and information to state law enforcement personnel for official duties. Any information received should be used in accordance with guidelines.
